Target: OntoPlot is an ontology developed to describe the attributes of land plots and their buildable spaces.

Comment: Absolute Height defines Buildable Space volume in meters. Absolute Height may be derived from number of storeys linked to Storey Aggregate and each storey's Floor To Floor Height.
Label: Absolute Height

Comment: Average depth represent average plot depth resulting from averaging sample depths along the plot's front edges
Label: Average Depth

Comment: Average width represent average plot width resulting from averaging sample widths along the plot's side edges.
Label: Average Width

Comment: Buildable Space is the maximum allowable space on a plot that can built up according to relevant planning regulations. Buildable spaces may be linked to a Zone, LandUse or a particular Programme if there exist specific regulations. For instance, a plot on which flat and condominium developments are allowed, will have two buildable spaces - one for condominium and one for flat as a product of unique planning regulation combinations.
Label: Buildable Space

Comment: A Floor To Floor Height defines the storey height, from current storey floor to the floor of the next storey.
Label: Floor To Floor Height

Comment: Footprint defines a boundary within which a specific storey exist.
Label: Footprint

Comment: Allowed Footprint Area linked to a specific storey.
Label: Footprint Area

Comment: Allowed Gross Floor Area is a sum of all allowed Footprint Areas for a specific Buildable Space.
Label: Gross Floor Area

Comment: As defined in https://www.ura.gov.sg/-/media/Corporate/Planning/Master-Plan/MP19writtenstatement.pdf
Label: Gross Plot Ratio

Comment: Setback defines distances that any development needs to be setbacked from plot boundary.
Label: Setback

Comment: Front Setback applies to plot's side that has the main entrance facing the road.
Label: Front Setback

Comment: Rear Setback applies to plot side that is opposite of plot's front side.
Label: Rear Setback

Comment: Road Buffer refers to setbacks related to adjecent road category instead of plot sides. Plot may have more than one road buffer if it is adjacent to multiple road plots.
Label: Road Buffer

Comment: Side Setback apply to the plot's side that is not Front nor Rear.
Label: Side Setback

Comment: PartyWall setback refers to Side setback whose buffer distance is required to be 0m.
Label: Party Wall

Comment: A plot is an area of land that is often delineated with a physical boundary to denote land ownership rights. It is frequently adopted as a basic spatial unit for a cadastre or land registration system.
Label: Plot

Comment: Site area or plot area.
Label: Site Area

Comment: Site Coverage defines the ratio between Site Area And Buildable Space 1st Storeys footprint area.
Label: Site Coverage

Comment: Storey refers to the spaces that within Buildable Space that are at the same height and does not require vertical connections.
Label: Storey

Comment: Storey aggregate defines Buildable Space volume in storeys. Each buildable space will have one storey aggregate, consisting of multiple storeys.
Label: Storey Aggregate

Comment: Building Edge is an uninterupted set of storeys starting from the groundfloor that share the same setback and form a uniform volume.
Label: Building Edge
has allowed floor to floor height

Domain: AbsoluteHeight UNION FloorToFloorHeight UNION GrossFloorArea UNION GrossPlotRatio UNION Setback UNION SiteCoverage UNION StoreyAggregate
Label: has source
